title: I have an idea for a vayne W change...
body:
How about you give her multiple types of bolts? like she can switch them either at base or out of combat. she's supposed to be this demon hunter but not every demon is a tank. riot's issues with silver bolts has been it was too good against tanks AND squishies. ok, give her separate "ammo" so she has to choose for the specific situation. you could also give other bolts too like just plain burst physical damage thats not %hp or some kind of slow effect every 3rd hit or something. I feel like there's alot of unexplored potential here.

Or maybe im just silver and need to shut up ;-;

I've been fishing, and learned a bit about hunting and can confirm that whatever pray you plan to hunt you tend to pack for in regards to how you want to kill it.

Hey, I will get on board with with. 

W. Cast w to choose from 4 different types of ammo. 10 second cooldown. 0 Mana cost. 

After casting w cast Q,W,E, or R to 'lock in' which type of ammo you want to use 

W-Q. 6-7-8-9-10 percent true damage (remove flat damage as that simply makes it better against squishy champions)
W-W. every 3 attacks against the same target slows then by 20-25-30-35-40 percent for .5 seconds.
W-E. Every third auto attack against the same target deals 25-50-75-100-125 bonus magic damage (can crit for double damage) (mainly used for killing Squishies)
W-R. Every 3rd auto attack against the same target, reduce damage dealt to zero and gain that damage as a shield blocking only physical damage.


Ideas to at least facilitate discussion.

what would be best for w switching would be every third attack deals EITHER % physical damage or flat true

so she has to chose

your idea is more of a staight buff - besides, 4 is way too much

In some cases probably. I wouldn't agree that 4 is too much. However I would agree that my ideas all in the same kit could be overbearing.

The slow would probably be the worst tbh. Giving Vayne that kind of kiting would be a bit too strong likely.
yeah maybe a slow isnt the best idea. maybe a bolt for extra range, but her attack speed will be lowered. kinda like jinx but still single target obv.

I disagree with this statement, his suggestion isn't a straight buff.

Percent max health true damage isn't inherently unhealthy. It's the only thing that crushes tanks, as they build both health and resistances. Removing all flat damage (including vayne's base ad)  is a definite nerf for that choice against all targets, especially squishies. Making the percent higher makes it a big buff against tanks, but still a big nerf against squishies.

The 10sec cooldown is probably too low. She shouldn't be changing it mid fight. Maybe 15sec, and cooldown gets increased to 5sec if below that (but above 0) and she's in combat.

The point being to give her specialization (so if she is using the right bolt for the target she'll be stronger than live) but make her need to make that choice properly. Then balance her accordingly.

Good meme. %HP true damage is why tanks are barely played. You have LW, BC, and botrk to deal with tanks. No-one should have %HP true damage just because muh adc. It ruins the point of tanks and is unfun in general.

> [{quoted}](name=IkBenShteen,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2vsO8UEU,comment-id=0001000000020000,timestamp=2018-05-16T09:24:55.827+0000)
>
> Good meme. %HP true damage is why tanks are barely played. You have LW, BC, and botrk to deal with tanks. No-one should have %HP true damage just because muh adc. It ruins the point of tanks and is unfun in general.

That's a discussion for a different thread.

The point of my post is that if you remove all of the flat damage (including Vayne's base AD) then it's not a buff to her. Giving optionality in return for any individual option being weaker than what she has currently in some way (but situationally it can be more useful) is a change, not a buff. 

As for how the discussion would go in another thread? People will comment that without that damage, you have tanks taking over the game, where no one is killable and there's no reason to play anything but a tank. I honestly think we need tank killers and am glad they exist to do their job, **even as someone who's favorite patches of league were the cinderhulk meta**.

I love tanks in league, and would rather have tanks on my team than any other role. I also dread going into games where the enemy has 3+ tanks (especially when they have something like a Galio or Gragas or Malphite mid lane) because if you don't crush early it's practically a guaranteed loss. People go on and on that the game is dictated by the ADC (and sure, those games the ADC is doing all the damage on their team as they have 4 allies permanently locking down all their enemies), but really it's tanks that make the bigger contribution, ADCs just get the nice looking score, the gold, and the damage. Even with champions like Vayne and Kog'maw, tanks still do their job well. It's a lot more about their ability to reliably lock down targets, than it is about them eating thousands of damage every few seconds and surviving. Defensive stats give tanks a lot of buffer room (and notably time to do multiple CC rotations), but a good tank with a good team won't lose much health at all because the damage dealers will be CC'd and killed before they get the chance to bust the tank. Give them too much tankiness and eventually the buffer turns into a guarantee, and that's unhealthy. Having tank shredders helps ensure that tanks still need to get that CC off in a reasonable time to win the fight.

Still this keeps in the question. Should ADC's be the honeypots of league that supposedly do all of this with right clicking and barely any skill involved? Kiting a tank (given you have a janna support or something) is so damn easy, and the damage is currently so high that defensive stats don't really mean much. Given mundo and a few others that have mad regen, also tahm with his double health bar, sure we need some tankbusting adc's. Does that mean they should defeat tanks with a built in %hp true damage trick? Not really.

Either change the W to %hp in physical damage, even magic for all I care, but allow for tanks to counterbuild it (to a given point). Honestly it's a gigantic meme that anything shreds tanks these days. The itemization of tanks is expensive, they don't do that much damage (ignore galio etc hence those are more like AP bruisers to me) and their items get countered by some nonsense ability that chunks mad health. I'm not saying ADC's shouldn't be able to defeat tanks, i'm saying they shouldn't be able to do it unless far ahead or with a support. They are supposed to be squishy damage dealers with high damage capability and strong lategames. Not early monsters that just 1v1 you with no chance to actually deal damage to them before they healed back up to max due to the sickening amount of sustain currently in the game.

Vayne is supposedly someone who hunts enemies, her kit screams this. It doesn't mean she should be able to ignore tanks. Again a vayne that builds attackspeed only can still chunk your health away without any AD items. It just amazes me how people think this true damage %hp mechanic is healthy. Not to mention the conquerer bullshit. It should all be removed imo. I understand ADC's should take down tanks. Just not in 5 seconds. They are supposed to be raid bosses and take huge chunks of damage to tank for their squishy teammates. Not be a big ball of health that takes 5s to munch through.

Good idea but it needs to have a decent cooldown (30+ seconds) so she has to plan ahead for the situation she's going to be in.  That's one problem I have with 2 form champs (Jayce, Nidalee, Elise) is they can switch back and forth too easily.  If they pick the wrong form they can switch back in like 3 seconds.  Therefore I think it should have a long cooldown so if she picks the wrong ammo type, she is punished for it.
yeah or just make it so she can only change ammo types at base. maybe they can even be really strong effects, but she has to buy them instead?

Yeah, every time she gets CS with her Q she should gets some type of currency. 

She could then exchange 500 of these points to upgrade her W.

Also instead of having point and click 3 hit passive, what if it was harder for Vayne to proc her W damage?

Like imagine, what if her W allowed her to place a barrel, and she could connect barrels and blow them up using her auto attacks or Q. If a barrel connects on an enemy then they get hit with her W passive - doing massive damage. But not true damage. However, to deal with tanks it should ignore a %of armour if she connects her barrels... idk... maybe 40%?
Hmmm. What if they made her melee but put her auto-attack on a ranged ability... And what if they gave her a cc cleanse and global ultimate? Nah, that'd be too op. /s

As usual with this kind of threads...

Why?

The idea isn't bad (it's even rather good, as others have mentioned), but what's your goal? Why take the time and the people it takes to do that change? Never do change just for the sake of change, you need to have a precise objective in mind.

And THAT is what's important to communicate. The rest can be ironed out later down the road if everyone agree on the goal, but when you're just making a paper kit on a Board, the goal you want to achieve is what matters.

Well, I've played over 3k games with vayne. I've player her when she was op, i've played her when she was a troll pick. I want to 1, give her a clear identity rather than just "tank shredder adc" we have 3 of those. 2, i want silver bolts to be less of a balancing nightmare and the subject of complaint by literally everyone that dosen't play vayne. I'm just throwing ideas out there but vayne's main pain point tends to be her W. Also, nothing in her lore is reflected in her kit, besides the fact she hunts evil. what makes her different from batman or Diablo 3's demon hunter?

* I'm not convinced by the lore aspect (just my personal opinion, your mileage may vary).
* Want to give her a clear identity: You mean a mechanical/strategical one? It's still not clear after this change to me. "The ADC that has a tool for every situation"? Also, it might feel similar to jinx bazooka/mini-gun, depending on the actual effect of each type of ammo.
* Less of a balance nightmare: I think this would have the opposite effect. Adding more features and flexibility to a kit makes it harder to balance overall. Silver Bolts may lack enough tuning levers, but having different types of ammo means they all have to be balanced (no clearly superior one), they all have to feel distinct enough to be worth swapping, and it will create a huge skill gap between high MMR who'll always have the proper ammo selected, and low MMR where they won't optimize it. Now, none of those are impossible problems to solve, but if the goal is "make her simpler to balance", I don't think that goal will be reached.

Also, I should have asked that first, but are you just theorycrafting for its own sake (and yeah, it's fun :) ), or are you trying to convince Riot to actually make some changes?

i want to see actual changes. as it stands, vayne is pretty unfun to play until 3 items or 30 min into the game. she gets bullied by literally everyone because she has so much power late game. meanwhile tristana has a fairly decent early game, is safe at all points of the game, better item spikes better steroids and carries just as hard if not harder.

OK, so, yeah, the bar to pass for that is even higher. If you want to convince Riot to do some actual work, the current version won't cut it. You need to make it more specific than just "I don't know, giver her different ammo" and more focused on a precise objective.

Sorry, don't want to be harsh, but that's the truth of it. They're already taking months to finally get to projects they WANT to do (see, a new passive for Lissandra, or a better plant system for Zyra), so convincing them to take on additional projects on top if it is a big hurdle.

Good luck with that, and I'm looking forward to your next iteration ;)

I think the goal was to make Vayne match some of her Lore more(and maybe nerf her idk) cause it's pretty safe to assume that Vayne fights a LOT of different types of demons, right?


So different types of Bolts for different types of demons maybe?

Fire demon = weak to water so Vayne uses water bolts or somethin

water demon = weak to grass so Vayne uses grass bolts or a stick or whatever

grass demon = weak to fire so Vayne uses a lighter and some gasoline or fire-bolts or maybe flint+steel IDK
Well, that's not a convincing reason to change an existing champion, to me. Tons of champions have lore and gameplay disconnected from each others for various reasons.
Oh it's definitely a bad reason to change Vayne, just wanted to help clarify the OP for ya

I like this idea.  

When Vayne presses and holds W, she channels while cycling through several bolt options and selects one by releasing the key.  Her next basic attack will have one of the following on-hit effects.

1) Barbed.  The enemy suffers Grievous Wounds for 5 seconds.

2) Weighted.  The target is slowed by 30% for 3 seconds.

3) Silvered.  Silver Bolts will require only two hits to proc for the next 4 seconds.

10 second cooldown.  80 mana cost.

****

Or we just put Silver Bolts into her passive and give her an actual ability on her W.  How about these?

Night’s Haste - Vayne throws her crossbow over her shoulder and sprints, quickly gaining 20% bonus movement speed after a brief channel.  While the channel does not interrupt Vayne’s movement, it disarms her, and she remains disarmed while sprinting.  Re-casting Night’s Haste orders Vayne stop sprinting and draw her crossbow after another similar channel.
vaynes crossbow is attached to her wrist... it doesnt really interfere with her running.....
This is actually a great idea. When Vayne finally gets that VGU she needs this should at least be tested.
Like twisted fate :)

Honestly this might be a little oppressive. She already has burst potential vs squishies because of her Q and her building crit on top of it. Her W isn't the reason she kills squishies easily so I don't see a reason why giving her W a choice to kill squishies is a good idea. Back when On-hit Vayne was her meta build maybe, but now, I don't see a reason for it.

Real talk tho, people complain about Vayne a lot and I think they don't take the whole kit into consideration. She has single target damage and if she fucks up and hits someone else she loses stacks of silver bolts. She doesn't have any attack speed steroid and she doesn't have anything that gives her extra range.  She has a hard lane when people actually know how to pressure and bring presence into a lane.
I mean, i know that all too well having played over 3k games. most adcs are a bad matchup for her to be completely honest. she just has to deal with it and outscale.

Vayne isn't meta right now, weak, or overbearing. She has no issues currently. Riot's issue with Silver Bolts rarely happens and Patch 8.1 was simply because they skipped over changing Vayne with every other ADC. Just because Silver Bolts kills squishies and tanks doesn't mean it's bad - that's its intended purpose. She's meant to rely on attack speed to proc it as much as possible.

She's viable. I can literally go up to Diamond with her if I tried right now.

It's a cute idea but this idea is forcing a rework on her kit which Vayne mains, at least I, don't see needed and a rework she doesn't need. It also complicates her teamfighting potential and cuts down her DPS. A rework to a kit should only be if needed due to gameplay issues/practicality or if the kit is too weak and Vayne doesn't need it. Even if it's pretty, the kit is fine and her current kit works better than this. This is more of a nerfed version of Vayne.

Her kit identity is also to make use of the most simplistic things - thus a simple kit but many ways to use it optimally.

I agree with everything said here. People seem to forget that a lot of the issues Vayne had recently were because of her ability to one-shot squishies due to her empowered Q-crits rather than her W. She's actually in a fairly balanced spot at the moment.

I agree, but the issue is that defensive itemization does not really have that much to reduce someone's attack speed. You have one item (frozen heart) that gives a 20% reduction. 20% is nothing while ardent censer and runes like lethal tempo are existing. The issue lies with multiple things. One of them being that the %hp is true damage rather than normal physical damage (as if LW isn't busted already). I just feel like ADC's get too much freedom into busting squishy's and tanks with the same build path everytime, while only building a single item for penetration.

First, Vayne doesn't use lethal tempo often - she loses on sustain. You're trying to use an edge case to justify a point which doesn't work here because that edge case statistically is insignificant.

Vayne's W bursts less than crit all game because it's so attack speed reliant it needs at least 3 attack speed items to contest. One crit does more damage than one W proc - Vayne is much more item-reliant than other ADCs. 

There's a reason she's sitting at a low winrate and getting destroyed early to mid-game.

> The issue lies with multiple things. One of them being that the %hp is true damage rather than normal physical damage (as if LW isn't busted already).

She's at a 48% winrate. You can't say there's an issue with her - she's at a low point already. Anymore nerfs will make her unviable. Her kit is fine. At this point, statistically, if you lose to a Vayne - you deserve to lose. You can't pin it on her kit at that point.

> (as if LW isn't busted already). I just feel like ADC's get too much freedom into busting squishy's and tanks with the same build path everytime, while only building a single item for penetration.

Riot is nerfing crit and ADCs in general. Don't worry.

I'm genuinely more upset with toplane and jungle than ADC. The game is kind of going down the shitter anyways with the bs amount of free true damage every fighter gets. Everyone runs conquerer and imo it defys the whole game at this point. I don't even care about vayne anymore. It's the conquerer abusing champs that piss me of. Keystone needs to be removed asap

This is actually a really cool idea

Although it needs some work, I feel like giving her more skill expression on having to decide whether to be stronger against squishy characters or tanky characters is a good idea

However, Vayne is commonly seen as a tank shredder adc, so it could be that her W just needs some nerfs on its base damage

they've done that twice already and it just makes her laning garbage. Like vayne and tris are "hypercarries" but tris' laning isn't even that bad. and she's not weak early or mid game and carries just as hard as vayne can from 200 more range away.

Really cool idea actually.

Rysophage: literally about 90% of Vayne's damage is in her Q, not her W. W doesn't activate enough unless you are an idled player who doesn't retreat or CC.

Her Q readily hits for 1600-1700, and on late game has as low as a 2 second cooldown. Once she has {{item:3036}} , that is why she shreds, not her W.

W is actually her weakest ability.

Even her E does double damage if it wall knocks.

Silver Bolts activates every 3 attacks. It's not that much damage...

Something to realize as well: There really isn't much "Tank" anymore vs AD carries. Armor shred is just too accessible on all roles. Even if an AD carry doesn't get {{item:3071}} , their allies DO. which means a {{item:3036}} just takes away almost all armor.

In a game where you naturally might have 70 Armor, but built 300 Armor, You're likely lowered to 56 or so Armor after all armor reductions/ignored are applied. 

HP is more tanky than Armor. That's where the game is now.

Yeh and stacking HP will just boost her W damage output so that is already negated :P Not to mention it is not a current health reduction, it's max health. And with the upcoming changes to BOTRK, it will be even worse for HP stacking tanks. There's so much shit to deal with tanks, just build pen. Yet no real itemization to defend from such mechanics as mr and armor just get shredded these days. Stacking hp is just useless as you become a giant meatball that people grind through.
I like the idea but it may do the exact opposite of what you want. She may end up becoming a generalist champion who can deal with anything accordingly
Not a bad idea tbh.
lowkey genius over here
Vayne with 250 attkspeed plus presicion and 3 hit you with slow then switch to physical dmg ....that scary...to me
As neat as this sounds, i feel this creeps on Jinx's design space too much.
of maybe true damage above certain hp then it will become phys damage
Physical damage would have to be broken like her R to be worth taking over % because the % is so high.

This is a neat idea that Riot will never implement because it would change Vayne from having clearly-defined strengths and weaknesses to Lee "no weaknesses" Sin with an overloaded kit. Such a jack-of-all-trades kit would have to be a master of none, which is a nice way of saying she'd be nerfed into the ground to keep anyone from playing her outside Co-op vs AI.

Can you provide a source for Riot saying that Vayne's W is too good against everyone, or that it's too good against tanks, or that it's too good against squishies, or that it has any issues at all?
